titleproper.value: Guide to Judy Nylon Collection on New York City Tenants' Rights <num>MSS.583</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-08-29T20:59:32</date>

unittitle.value: Judy Nylon Collection on New York City Tenants' Rights

abstract.value: Judy Nylon (Niland) (1948-  ) is a multidisciplinary American artist and musician. The Judy Nylon Collection on New York City Tenants' Rights contains photographs, correspondence, tenants' rights publications, newspaper clippings, and other notes related to accusations of housing violations made regarding a New York City apartment building that Judy Nylon and other occupants rented.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Judy Nylon Collection on New York City Tenants' Rights; MSS 583; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Judy Nylon, February 10, 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.046.

Nylon's multi-disciplinary work focuses on international co-authorship and decentralized many-to-many style video storytelling. Since 2007 she has periodically contributed to the collective Aether9, who collaborate on multinational multi-streamed networked performances intending to develop low-cost, open-source, nomadic public art production.
In 2010, Nylon contributed guest vocals to the <emph render="italic">Babylon By Car</emph> album by the French electronica group Bot'Ox.

This collection (dated 1999-2011) contains photographs of apartment and building damage, correspondence, tenants' rights publications, newspaper clippings, and other notes related to accusations of housing violations made regarding a New York City apartment building that Judy Nylon and other occupants rent.

subject.value: Housing -- Law and legislation -- United States.
Landlord and tenant -- New York (State) -- New York
